( Carnage: I regret to say that I have no time to reply with Carnage at this 
time.I shall later on.)

** Dinobot simply growled in response to Tavatron's words, though they had a 
ring of truth to every one.
Most of the Maximals had obeyed command and had come to the commander's aid, 
yet they had all fought in a sloppy formation if anyone could call their 
battle tactics any formation at all. This faction was disorganized and it 
would take a reasonable amount of time in order to assemble it into a 
workable force once again. Though the main hand problem in which he though 
was the cause of all this was not the attitude of the transformers under 
command, but the shere number of them. There were too many of them!
Back in his past life there had been a workable amount of both friend and 
foe; just enough to pose a threat and keep a bot on his/her toes. But now 
the numbers were simply too high and a battle could be won on number alone. 
The ability to battle was no longer needed.
Frankly...it disgusted him.
This was not a war anylonger. It was which faction decided which other one 
would live to battle with another day. There were no warriors here. Just 
sheep ready for the slaughter!
Dinobot hardly noticed as Tavatron moved away from him, walking over to 
stand near their commander. His mind too set in seeing just which aspects of 
this faction needed to be dealt with over others. Though the more he thought 
the more he wondered just why he remained with this faction.
There was nothing keeping him there, nothing at all. Though he would never 
turn against them and join an enemy force. If he did leave he would go 
neutral. Besides, he felt no ties to the base or the Maximals. He would miss 
nothing.
However, even that wasn't true.
He would miss the battles. And a warrior without battles to fight was not a 
warrior at all.
Dinobot crossed his arms and locked his sight in on the enemy, though only 
his eyes followed them all.
Something had to happen besides this waiting. Something, anything. It just 
had to happen, and soon.**
